intro: Selinum angolense, commonly known as the Angolan selinum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a taproot system that allows it to access water from deeper underground. Selinum angolense is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
